      function setAttributeOnload(object, attribute, val) {
       if(window.addEventListener) {
         window.addEventListener('load',
           function(){ object[attribute] = val; }, false);
       } else {
         window.attachEvent('onload', function(){ object[attribute] = val; });
       }
     }

              <div class="main section" id="main" name="Main">
               <div class="widget Blog" data-version="1" id="Blog1">
                <div class="blog-posts hfeed">
                 <div class="date-outer">
                  <h2 class="date-header">
                   <span>
                    Friday, June 22, 2018
                   </span>
                  </h2>
                  <div class="date-posts">
                   <div class="post-outer">
                    <div class="post hentry uncustomized-post-template" itemprop="blogPost" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="http://schema.org/BlogPosting">
                     <meta content="https://1.bp.blogspot.com/--3PQ7lJwC6Y/WxnUftcRJjI/AAAAAAABBF8/FnWPDFUvTxoUEsGnJWXxNohXCUOhML3qACLcBGAs/s1600/1%2Bpost%2BB%2B1.jpg" itemprop="image_url"/>
                     <meta content="4349727365634393854" itemprop="blogId"/>
                     <meta content="2213030721206768562" itemprop="postId"/>
                     <a name="2213030721206768562">
                     </a>
                     <h3 class="post-title entry-title" itemprop="name">
                      <a href="http://wappellious.blogspot.com/2018/06/guerre-des-chars.html">
                       Guerre Des Chars
                      </a>
                     </h3>
                     <div class="post-header">
                      <div class="post-header-line-1">
                      </div>
                     </div>
                     <div class="post-body entry-content" id="post-body-2213030721206768562" itemprop="description articleBody">
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <a href="https://1.bp.blogspot.com/--3PQ7lJwC6Y/WxnUftcRJjI/AAAAAAABBF8/FnWPDFUvTxoUEsGnJWXxNohXCUOhML3qACLcBGAs/s1600/1%2Bpost%2BB%2B1.jpg" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;">
                        <img border="0" data-original-height="577" data-original-width="573" src="https://1.bp.blogspot.com/--3PQ7lJwC6Y/WxnUftcRJjI/AAAAAAABBF8/FnWPDFUvTxoUEsGnJWXxNohXCUOhML3qACLcBGAs/s1600/1%2Bpost%2BB%2B1.jpg"/>
                       </a>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <br/>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       I painted these vehicles during a recent hangout on the Styrene Syndicate, having quite a bit of fun!  Eventually I want to be able to create a few battle reports that include these Renaults, plus the completed Somuas and Char B1 Bis.
                      </div>
                      <br/>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <a href="https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-S6UoKzJJPms/WxnUgPG0WyI/AAAAAAABBGA/qunDEazzhcwSRWdD2UzhcVflWm1MGko-QCLcBGAs/s1600/1%2Bpost%2BB%2B2.jpg" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;">
                        <img border="0" data-original-height="508" data-original-width="1548" src="https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-S6UoKzJJPms/WxnUgPG0WyI/AAAAAAABBGA/qunDEazzhcwSRWdD2UzhcVflWm1MGko-QCLcBGAs/s1600/1%2Bpost%2BB%2B2.jpg"/>
                       </a>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <br/>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       Eventually I may use them for Vichy French in a Torch campaign, or possibly for Syria.
                      </div>
                      <br/>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <a href="https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-a3pTY7fHH28/WxnUgMeHA1I/AAAAAAABBGE/-v6Ce5N4gOYKSbcP1--tgDGnEmF6YZw7QCLcBGAs/s1600/1%2Bpost%2BB%2B3.jpg" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;">
                        <img border="0" data-original-height="429" data-original-width="1600" src="https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-a3pTY7fHH28/WxnUgMeHA1I/AAAAAAABBGE/-v6Ce5N4gOYKSbcP1--tgDGnEmF6YZw7QCLcBGAs/s1600/1%2Bpost%2BB%2B3.jpg"/>
                       </a>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <br/>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       I have not tried to replicate any specific DLM units yet... I think that process will have to come later when I can figure out the best way to make more new vehicles, or acquire existing tank kits.  Lately I have learned a great deal about how to scratch build vehicles!
                      </div>
                      <br/>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <a href="https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-Z4hTEJSMrfA/WxnUgXIBwwI/AAAAAAABBGI/FugGgu_uhrc56F2mGRmsfRHaYhWExviSQCLcBGAs/s1600/1%2Bpost%2BB%2B3a.jpg" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;">
                        <img border="0" data-original-height="569" data-original-width="900" src="https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-Z4hTEJSMrfA/WxnUgXIBwwI/AAAAAAABBGI/FugGgu_uhrc56F2mGRmsfRHaYhWExviSQCLcBGAs/s1600/1%2Bpost%2BB%2B3a.jpg"/>
                       </a>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <br/>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       These were painted with acrylics, using mostly Secret Weapon Weathering paints (that includes the camo colors as well)
                      </div>
                      <br/>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <a href="https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-RSmpdspuUkI/WxnUhNIHBXI/AAAAAAABBGM/R0BrzXj-i6Af4HR5CO8YFFSi0wMRgw3sgCLcBGAs/s1600/1%2Bpost%2BB%2B4.jpg" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;">
                        <img border="0" data-original-height="512" data-original-width="1554" src="https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-RSmpdspuUkI/WxnUhNIHBXI/AAAAAAABBGM/R0BrzXj-i6Af4HR5CO8YFFSi0wMRgw3sgCLcBGAs/s1600/1%2Bpost%2BB%2B4.jpg"/>
                       </a>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <br/>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       My intent was to film a battle report with them right away, so I wanted them to be as dry as possible.  I also wanted to demonstrate what the Secret Weapon paints could do.
                      </div>
                      <br/>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <a href="https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-HSJcHtAEj-A/WxnUhTU1uEI/AAAAAAABBGQ/y2upkFBgC044zFrJEgaaqMwS9UqluUzfwCLcBGAs/s1600/1%2Bpost%2BB%2B5.jpg" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;">
                        <img border="0" data-original-height="604" data-original-width="1548" src="https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-HSJcHtAEj-A/WxnUhTU1uEI/AAAAAAABBGQ/y2upkFBgC044zFrJEgaaqMwS9UqluUzfwCLcBGAs/s1600/1%2Bpost%2BB%2B5.jpg"/>
                       </a>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <br/>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       Once things calm down here a little, I will try to do more Twitch broadcasts.  I think those will be even more useful than the Facebook live sessions for longer painting processes such as painting a platoon of vehicles!  Those seem to be geared more for a "worktable" session, as opposed to a single very targeted lesson.
                      </div>
                      <br/>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <a href="https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-AelYAm9KJy4/WxnUhrto6XI/AAAAAAABBGU/ivrY9JqU2xUCoVehfaFzG0M4Xn9k_qF7wCLcBGAs/s1600/1%2Bpost%2BB%2B6.jpg" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;">
                        <img border="0" data-original-height="330" data-original-width="1586" src="https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-AelYAm9KJy4/WxnUhrto6XI/AAAAAAABBGU/ivrY9JqU2xUCoVehfaFzG0M4Xn9k_qF7wCLcBGAs/s1600/1%2Bpost%2BB%2B6.jpg"/>
                       </a>
                      </div>
                      <br/>
                      <div style="clear: both;">
                      </div>
                     </div>
                     <div class="post-footer">
                      <div class="post-footer-line post-footer-line-1">

                 <div class="date-outer">
                  <h2 class="date-header">
                   <span>
                    Thursday, June 21, 2018
                   </span>
                  </h2>
                  <div class="date-posts">
                   <div class="post-outer">
                    <div class="post hentry uncustomized-post-template" itemprop="blogPost" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="http://schema.org/BlogPosting">
                     <meta content="https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-rwmXMTp0tjI/WynztQnJlQI/AAAAAAABBjE/Y32J8YrKXA0oGSFgO4fcczYvvaIH_b8MwCLcBGAs/s1600/Dwarf%2BB%2B1.jpg" itemprop="image_url"/>
                     <meta content="4349727365634393854" itemprop="blogId"/>
                     <meta content="1452210149549216854" itemprop="postId"/>
                     <a name="1452210149549216854">
                     </a>
                     <h3 class="post-title entry-title" itemprop="name">
                      <a href="http://wappellious.blogspot.com/2018/06/stepping-stones.html">
                       Stepping Stones
                      </a>
                     </h3>
                     <div class="post-header">
                      <div class="post-header-line-1">
                      </div>
                     </div>
                     <div class="post-body entry-content" id="post-body-1452210149549216854" itemprop="description articleBody">
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <a href="https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-rwmXMTp0tjI/WynztQnJlQI/AAAAAAABBjE/Y32J8YrKXA0oGSFgO4fcczYvvaIH_b8MwCLcBGAs/s1600/Dwarf%2BB%2B1.jpg" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;">
                        <img border="0" data-original-height="577" data-original-width="573" src="https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-rwmXMTp0tjI/WynztQnJlQI/AAAAAAABBjE/Y32J8YrKXA0oGSFgO4fcczYvvaIH_b8MwCLcBGAs/s1600/Dwarf%2BB%2B1.jpg"/>
                       </a>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <br/>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       One of my favorite miniature lines is Siren Miniatures, for a few reasons.
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <br/>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       First, there is always a lot of wonderful detail, but not at the expense of "paintability".  Even though there is a decent amount of details and other elements, you can still paint these up without much tedium or difficulty.
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <br/>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       There's also quite a bit of flow and movement in the poses, even when the subject is a dwarf like this guy!
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <br/>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       Check out the rest of the collection on their website:
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <span style="color: yellow; font-size: x-large;">
                        <b>
                         <br/>
                        </b>
                       </span>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <a href="http://sirenminiatures.com/">
                        <span style="color: yellow; font-size: x-large;">
                         <b>
                          http://sirenminiatures.com/
                         </b>
                        </span>
                       </a>
                      </div>
                      <br/>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <a href="https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-KkXN5C8B58w/Wynzt1rXTdI/AAAAAAABBjM/3tGvcgF89qUwNqQe5hBAAQDhI3FQr2qJACLcBGAs/s1600/Dwarf%2BB%2B2.jpg" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;">
                        <img border="0" data-original-height="1133" data-original-width="1297" src="https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-KkXN5C8B58w/Wynzt1rXTdI/AAAAAAABBjM/3tGvcgF89qUwNqQe5hBAAQDhI3FQr2qJACLcBGAs/s1600/Dwarf%2BB%2B2.jpg"/>
                       </a>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <br/>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       He's also available here:
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <br/>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <a href="https://www.ebay.com/itm/323305831137?ssPageName=STRK:MESELX:IT&amp;_trksid=p3984.m1555.l2649">
                        <span style="color: yellow; font-size: x-large;">
                         <b>
                          https://www.ebay.com/itm/323305831137?ssPageName=STRK:MESELX:IT&amp;_trksid=p3984.m1555.l2649
                         </b>
                        </span>
                       </a>
                      </div>
                      <br/>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <a href="https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-P7sp2NmRKVA/Wynzt_84J7I/AAAAAAABBjI/pPWFeCW6ezwxvZ6l8wgsMPcefWe9H5oYQCLcBGAs/s1600/Dwarf%2BB%2B3.jpg" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;">
                        <img border="0" data-original-height="1074" data-original-width="1254" src="https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-P7sp2NmRKVA/Wynzt_84J7I/AAAAAAABBjI/pPWFeCW6ezwxvZ6l8wgsMPcefWe9H5oYQCLcBGAs/s1600/Dwarf%2BB%2B3.jpg"/>
                       </a>
                      </div>
                      <br/>
                      <div style="clear: both;">
                      </div>
                     </div>
                     <div class="post-footer">

                      </div>
                      <div class="post-footer-line post-footer-line-3">
                       <span class="post-location">
                       </span>
                      </div>
                     </div>
                    </div>
                   </div>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                 <div class="date-outer">
                  <h2 class="date-header">
                   <span>
                    Wednesday, June 20, 2018
                   </span>
                  </h2>
                  <div class="date-posts">
                   <div class="post-outer">
                    <div class="post hentry uncustomized-post-template" itemprop="blogPost" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="http://schema.org/BlogPosting">
                     <meta content="https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-zllq5VfGxiw/WybBgTtlBQI/AAAAAAABBew/-K0DH9X6H3ISjPZAg7hmgjqHk0peTAD2wCLcBGAs/s1600/Group%2BB%2B1.jpg" itemprop="image_url"/>
                     <meta content="4349727365634393854" itemprop="blogId"/>
                     <meta content="1380996373803370757" itemprop="postId"/>
                     <a name="1380996373803370757">
                     </a>
                     <h3 class="post-title entry-title" itemprop="name">
                      <a href="http://wappellious.blogspot.com/2018/06/the-clan-escher.html">
                       The Clan Escher
                      </a>
                     </h3>
                     <div class="post-header">
                      <div class="post-header-line-1">
                      </div>
                     </div>
                     <div class="post-body entry-content" id="post-body-1380996373803370757" itemprop="description articleBody">
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <a href="https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-zllq5VfGxiw/WybBgTtlBQI/AAAAAAABBew/-K0DH9X6H3ISjPZAg7hmgjqHk0peTAD2wCLcBGAs/s1600/Group%2BB%2B1.jpg" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;">
                        <img border="0" data-original-height="577" data-original-width="573" src="https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-zllq5VfGxiw/WybBgTtlBQI/AAAAAAABBew/-K0DH9X6H3ISjPZAg7hmgjqHk0peTAD2wCLcBGAs/s1600/Group%2BB%2B1.jpg"/>
                       </a>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <br/>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       At long last, the group image of the entire Clan Escher that was painted a while back.  This was the very first non historical unit that I tried painting in oils.
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <br/>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       When I worked on these, it was much earlier in my exploration of using oils on figures.  I have discovered many interesting techniques since, and now I paint a much higher percentage of the figures strictly with the oil paints.
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <br/>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       In particular, I now have many more high saturation oil colors than I did initially.  In fact, I now have a number of metallic oil colors... I was quite shocked to find out that they even existed at all.
                      </div>
                      <br/>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <a href="https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-tR6Uxwpx1Tk/WybBghKRVXI/AAAAAAABBe0/Pu4KYZakmwU1r2Mt3zFGJK69nRwVfv7sACLcBGAs/s1600/Group%2BB%2B2.jpg" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;">
                        <img border="0" data-original-height="1092" data-original-width="1215" src="https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-tR6Uxwpx1Tk/WybBghKRVXI/AAAAAAABBe0/Pu4KYZakmwU1r2Mt3zFGJK69nRwVfv7sACLcBGAs/s1600/Group%2BB%2B2.jpg"/>
                       </a>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <br/>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       Here's another look at the facebook live session which shows the beginning of the process:
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <span style="color: #fff2cc; font-size: x-large;">
                        <b>
                         <br/>
                        </b>
                       </span>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <a href="https://www.facebook.com/james.wappel/videos/vb.1056181987/10211936982874044/?type=2&amp;video_source=user_video_tab">
                        <span style="color: #fff2cc; font-size: x-large;">
                         <b>
                          https://www.facebook.com/james.wappel/videos/vb.1056181987/10211936982874044/?type=2&amp;video_source=user_video_tab
                         </b>
                        </span>
                       </a>
                      </div>
                      <br/>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <a href="https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-3oz1oX2irfw/WybBgtvbgtI/AAAAAAABBe4/EaqilIe0vO0UKLgzilgaQ_C5YrJAeFhrwCLcBGAs/s1600/Group%2BB%2B3.jpg" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;">
                        <img border="0" data-original-height="1258" data-original-width="1276" src="https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-3oz1oX2irfw/WybBgtvbgtI/AAAAAAABBe4/EaqilIe0vO0UKLgzilgaQ_C5YrJAeFhrwCLcBGAs/s1600/Group%2BB%2B3.jpg"/>
                       </a>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <br/>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       I have been prepping some more 40k figures that I will try out in oils as well.  These will be turned into new Painting Pyramid tutorial videos, done in multiple parts.
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <br/>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       I have created some new pledge levels on the Patreon Page to cover this in more detail.  They are referred to as the "Army Painter" levels.  The lower levels give you access to the instructional videos via YouTube links, while the higher levels get you hard copy USB drives with high resolution versions of the edited videos!
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <br/>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       There is an ultimate Army Painter level which also gets you the figures themselves...
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <br/>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       You can check that out on the page here:
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <br/>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <a href="http://www.patreon.com/JamesWappel">
                        <span style="color: #fff2cc; font-size: x-large;">
                         <b>
                          www.patreon.com/JamesWappel
                         </b>
                        </span>
                       </a>
                      </div>
                      <br/>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <a href="https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-XMj5ori6WF8/WybBgvc3PCI/AAAAAAABBe8/3PVutYPelUoG2umUsZdiURtoaqGvcjQCwCLcBGAs/s1600/Group%2BB%2B4.jpg" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;">
                        <img border="0" data-original-height="523" data-original-width="1159" src="https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-XMj5ori6WF8/WybBgvc3PCI/AAAAAAABBe8/3PVutYPelUoG2umUsZdiURtoaqGvcjQCwCLcBGAs/s1600/Group%2BB%2B4.jpg"/>
                       </a>
                      </div>
                      <br/>
                      <div style="clear: both;">
                      </div>
                     </div>
                     <div class="post-footer">
                      <div class="post-footer-line post-footer-line-1">

                 <div class="date-outer">
                  <h2 class="date-header">
                   <span>
                    Tuesday, June 19, 2018
                   </span>
                  </h2>
                  <div class="date-posts">
                   <div class="post-outer">
                    <div class="post hentry uncustomized-post-template" itemprop="blogPost" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="http://schema.org/BlogPosting">
                     <meta content="https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-iKYx9vPxiRc/Wyf0XvmzDHI/AAAAAAABBfc/DAzMEy0bIG0cqElv36TSCtncO8ZxmDr_wCLcBGAs/s1600/4%2BPost%2BB%2B1.jpg" itemprop="image_url"/>
                     <meta content="4349727365634393854" itemprop="blogId"/>
                     <meta content="8833603825502104336" itemprop="postId"/>
                     <a name="8833603825502104336">
                     </a>
                     <h3 class="post-title entry-title" itemprop="name">
                      <a href="http://wappellious.blogspot.com/2018/06/the-bridge-to-nouvion.html">
                       The Bridge to Nouvion
                      </a>
                     </h3>
                     <div class="post-header">
                      <div class="post-header-line-1">
                      </div>
                     </div>
                     <div class="post-body entry-content" id="post-body-8833603825502104336" itemprop="description articleBody">
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <a href="https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-iKYx9vPxiRc/Wyf0XvmzDHI/AAAAAAABBfc/DAzMEy0bIG0cqElv36TSCtncO8ZxmDr_wCLcBGAs/s1600/4%2BPost%2BB%2B1.jpg" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;">
                        <img border="0" data-original-height="577" data-original-width="573" src="https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-iKYx9vPxiRc/Wyf0XvmzDHI/AAAAAAABBfc/DAzMEy0bIG0cqElv36TSCtncO8ZxmDr_wCLcBGAs/s1600/4%2BPost%2BB%2B1.jpg"/>
                       </a>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <br/>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       To wrap up this latest terrain building series, I wanted to show you how things looked on the table.
                      </div>
                      <br/>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <a href="https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-bOQQN0ZaysM/Wyf0ZYWhdwI/AAAAAAABBf4/6O73d4gD28UtEGRVLn48mc9Me0BeNTREwCLcBGAs/s1600/4%2BPost%2BB%2B2.jpg" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;">
                        <img border="0" data-original-height="1200" data-original-width="1600" src="https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-bOQQN0ZaysM/Wyf0ZYWhdwI/AAAAAAABBf4/6O73d4gD28UtEGRVLn48mc9Me0BeNTREwCLcBGAs/s1600/4%2BPost%2BB%2B2.jpg"/>
                       </a>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <br/>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       As a reminder, I wanted to "extend" the banks of the river a little bit without having to create a new one.  So, I found these older tree stands I had made and revamped them:
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <br/>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <a href="http://wappellious.blogspot.com/2018/06/the-old-made-new-recycling-old-terrain.html">
                        <span style="color: lime; font-size: x-large;">
                         <b>
                          http://wappellious.blogspot.com/2018/06/the-old-made-new-recycling-old-terrain.html
                         </b>
                        </span>
                       </a>
                      </div>
                      <br/>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <a href="https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-0hQCGDltYhY/Wyf0Z4lC_7I/AAAAAAABBf8/Ok5iRbp9QMcV8AwjtNtSYZ5efLgoI03sQCLcBGAs/s1600/4%2BPost%2BB%2B3.jpg" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;">
                        <img border="0" data-original-height="1200" data-original-width="1600" src="https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-0hQCGDltYhY/Wyf0Z4lC_7I/AAAAAAABBf8/Ok5iRbp9QMcV8AwjtNtSYZ5efLgoI03sQCLcBGAs/s1600/4%2BPost%2BB%2B3.jpg"/>
                       </a>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <br/>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       I was extremely happy at the way the ground up loose leaf tea leaves matched the battle mat!  This is still the grassland/forest mat from TableWar.
                      </div>
                      <br/>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <a href="https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-L1bQ5A16We0/Wyf0aJPZaeI/AAAAAAABBgE/E3I33fO9laEzeV5pcI90khmGjgBE3GJlwCLcBGAs/s1600/4%2BPost%2BB%2B4.jpg" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;">
                        <img border="0" data-original-height="1200" data-original-width="1600" src="https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-L1bQ5A16We0/Wyf0aJPZaeI/AAAAAAABBgE/E3I33fO9laEzeV5pcI90khmGjgBE3GJlwCLcBGAs/s1600/4%2BPost%2BB%2B4.jpg"/>
                       </a>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <br/>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       This view gives you an idea of how much the river is now extended.  There is now rough ground extending several inches on either side, which should create the obstacle that I need.
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <br/>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       Creating a bridgehead on the opposite bank will be difficult, but there are significant victory point rewards for doing so.  I have also sculpted some boats for the Axis forces to use in this mission!
                      </div>
                      <br/>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <a href="https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-3-edWuakzfY/Wyf0avW0zNI/AAAAAAABBgA/Z0kU7i4wX0kOrcJrehOhIXOQLgG4mMu-gCLcBGAs/s1600/4%2BPost%2BB%2B5.jpg" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;">
                        <img border="0" data-original-height="1200" data-original-width="1600" src="https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-3-edWuakzfY/Wyf0avW0zNI/AAAAAAABBgA/Z0kU7i4wX0kOrcJrehOhIXOQLgG4mMu-gCLcBGAs/s1600/4%2BPost%2BB%2B5.jpg"/>
                       </a>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <br/>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       This is the sector where most of the British forces will begin the game.  Again, the mission is to evacuate as many units off the board as possible.  They are going to have to use the road, unlike the supporting French units which are acting as a holding force.
                      </div>
                      <br/>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <a href="https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-gV8RH0k2f1A/Wyf0bOZThFI/AAAAAAABBgI/mR9WVtniXCQMNMjvxAmZ1qeMZCtDOaZMQCLcBGAs/s1600/4%2BPost%2BB%2B6.jpg" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;">
                        <img border="0" data-original-height="1115" data-original-width="1600" src="https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-gV8RH0k2f1A/Wyf0bOZThFI/AAAAAAABBgI/mR9WVtniXCQMNMjvxAmZ1qeMZCtDOaZMQCLcBGAs/s1600/4%2BPost%2BB%2B6.jpg"/>
                       </a>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <br/>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       The Long Road to Nouvion and safety is going to be a hazardous one.  If British infantry units choose to take up positions around the embankment, they can still score some Victory Points by wiping out Axis units, but they are more valuable getting off the board.
                      </div>
                      <br/>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <a href="https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-yQrsWVw6b78/Wyf0bfeFrFI/AAAAAAABBgM/2Ty1fa4WSsc1ACnqNbzqVNxNG2_ZuKhcwCLcBGAs/s1600/4%2BPost%2BB%2B7.jpg" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;">
                        <img border="0" data-original-height="1200" data-original-width="1600" src="https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-yQrsWVw6b78/Wyf0bfeFrFI/AAAAAAABBgM/2Ty1fa4WSsc1ACnqNbzqVNxNG2_ZuKhcwCLcBGAs/s1600/4%2BPost%2BB%2B7.jpg"/>
                       </a>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <br/>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       The road seems very exposed, but there are a number of tree stands in the way, which serve as dense terrain.  The British units will have to take advantage of the initial Axis waves picking their way through all the dense foliage, the marshy banks and the river itself.
                      </div>
                      <br/>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <a href="https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-qaPigBFRX4Q/Wyf0bSNnx6I/AAAAAAABBgQ/YGFNsL52E5ERfKr7HCtmXFdl3mb265uVgCLcBGAs/s1600/4%2BPost%2BB%2B8.jpg" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;">
                        <img border="0" data-original-height="1200" data-original-width="1600" src="https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-qaPigBFRX4Q/Wyf0bSNnx6I/AAAAAAABBgQ/YGFNsL52E5ERfKr7HCtmXFdl3mb265uVgCLcBGAs/s1600/4%2BPost%2BB%2B8.jpg"/>
                       </a>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <br/>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       As the game moves along, there will be additional areas for the Axis units to enter the board.  In the latter half of the game, they will be able to enter through this edge, which might give them an easier field of fire at the retreating British units.
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <br/>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       There will be some French defenders in their path, and they might be well dug in by that point.
                      </div>
                      <br/>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                      </div>
                      <br/>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <a href="https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-3xeZywo0zFA/Wyf0X8PvdVI/AAAAAAABBfk/ufepKPavH24F3anUIMslwv_AEZIyR-lDACLcBGAs/s1600/4%2BPost%2BB%2B10.jpg" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;">
                        <img border="0" data-original-height="1170" data-original-width="1600" src="https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-3xeZywo0zFA/Wyf0X8PvdVI/AAAAAAABBfk/ufepKPavH24F3anUIMslwv_AEZIyR-lDACLcBGAs/s1600/4%2BPost%2BB%2B10.jpg"/>
                       </a>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <br/>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       As another point to note... the bridge cannot be destroyed!  The British need it to retreat, and the Axis forces would prefer to keep it intact themselves.  I do intend to have other missions where demolition is goal, so don't worry!
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <br/>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       The Axis forces are primarily an advance probing force, which also contains some armored elements.  You might even see a certain commander from Arras in his Panzer 38T!
                      </div>
                      <br/>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <a href="https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-NtLloc9eBwg/Wyf0XyPcb2I/AAAAAAABBfg/J5cjCMClnRklJ_pVQ7yJMiDRa7ALHdJLgCLcBGAs/s1600/4%2BPost%2BB%2B11.jpg" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;">
                        <img border="0" data-original-height="1108" data-original-width="1600" src="https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-NtLloc9eBwg/Wyf0XyPcb2I/AAAAAAABBfg/J5cjCMClnRklJ_pVQ7yJMiDRa7ALHdJLgCLcBGAs/s1600/4%2BPost%2BB%2B11.jpg"/>
                       </a>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <br/>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       I will be curious to see if this game involves the kind of close quarter fighting that was seen the the last battle report... Blood At Arras. There will be a larger contingent of Axis AFV's this time around, so I think that might get in the way.
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <br/>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       Here's a link to that one to get you caught up:
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <br/>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=njN4D64zH1k">
                        <span style="color: #fff2cc; font-size: x-large;">
                         <b>
                          https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=njN4D64zH1k
                         </b>
                        </span>
                       </a>
                      </div>
                      <br/>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <a href="https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-ENai2NR_u6U/Wyf0X5dC0AI/AAAAAAABBfo/bD5LJeTMXSMIIR1WQy3yXv6kc_o_SHcdACLcBGAs/s1600/4%2BPost%2BB%2B12.jpg" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;">
                        <img border="0" data-original-height="1200" data-original-width="1600" src="https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-ENai2NR_u6U/Wyf0X5dC0AI/AAAAAAABBfo/bD5LJeTMXSMIIR1WQy3yXv6kc_o_SHcdACLcBGAs/s1600/4%2BPost%2BB%2B12.jpg"/>
                       </a>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <br/>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       If you recall back to the original post, the idea behind these new terrain pieces is to make them as multi purpose as I can.  I had hoped to use this embankment as a ridge line in future battle reports, with trees and gun positions at the top.
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <br/>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       You can see those smaller tree stands on top of the ridge.
                      </div>
                      <br/>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <a href="https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-t52IbK8UXa8/Wyf0YAEsSVI/AAAAAAABBfs/JXNh4BiOCiIFo_0hrja_wOc_FvJVSrr3ACLcBGAs/s1600/4%2BPost%2BB%2B13.jpg" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;">
                        <img border="0" data-original-height="970" data-original-width="1600" src="https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-t52IbK8UXa8/Wyf0YAEsSVI/AAAAAAABBfs/JXNh4BiOCiIFo_0hrja_wOc_FvJVSrr3ACLcBGAs/s1600/4%2BPost%2BB%2B13.jpg"/>
                       </a>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <br/>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       This is the reason I did not sculpt in the usual road tracks, choosing to create the impression of such an effect with flock only.  Now that my tree stands are in place, the "road" is effectively invisible!
                      </div>
                      <br/>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <a href="https://4.bp.blogspot.com/--a2mPtqypOY/Wyf0YgO99GI/AAAAAAABBfw/NzW7-wQN7R8wLxuL0kuFremJZFaaouglQCLcBGAs/s1600/4%2BPost%2BB%2B14.jpg" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;">
                        <img border="0" data-original-height="1051" data-original-width="1600" src="https://4.bp.blogspot.com/--a2mPtqypOY/Wyf0YgO99GI/AAAAAAABBfw/NzW7-wQN7R8wLxuL0kuFremJZFaaouglQCLcBGAs/s1600/4%2BPost%2BB%2B14.jpg"/>
                       </a>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <br/>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       I am painting the rubber boats and other odds and ends which will make their first appearance in the "Bridge to Nouvion".  Changing the missions, terrain forces and various units in each of these reports takes a great deal of time, which is why it is taking me a bit longer to get each one made.  Once the terrain and the units are completed, it will be a little easier!
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <br/>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       Any support that you can offer on the Patreon Page is also a huge help, since it offsets the many hours of building, painting, terrain construction, filming, editing and so on!
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <br/>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <a href="http://www.patreon.com/JamesWappel">
                        <span style="color: yellow; font-size: x-large;">
                         <b>
                          www.patreon.com/JamesWappel
                         </b>
                        </span>
                       </a>
                      </div>
                      <br/>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <a href="https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-55I5VHbnj4A/Wyf0Y8oOMMI/AAAAAAABBf0/Q-y0OdFwbNsEjTDLUS4crAV5gYW-eoKEACLcBGAs/s1600/4%2BPost%2BB%2B15.jpg" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;">
                        <img border="0" data-original-height="1200" data-original-width="1600" src="https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-55I5VHbnj4A/Wyf0Y8oOMMI/AAAAAAABBf0/Q-y0OdFwbNsEjTDLUS4crAV5gYW-eoKEACLcBGAs/s1600/4%2BPost%2BB%2B15.jpg"/>
                       </a>
                      </div>
                      <br/>
                      <div style="clear: both;">
                      </div>
                     </div>

                      <div class="post-footer-line post-footer-line-2">
                       <span class="post-labels">
                       </span>
                      </div>
                      <div class="post-footer-line post-footer-line-3">
                       <span class="post-location">
                       </span>
                      </div>
                     </div>
                    </div>
                   </div>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                 <div class="date-outer">
                  <h2 class="date-header">
                   <span>
                    Sunday, June 17, 2018
                   </span>
                  </h2>
                  <div class="date-posts">
                   <div class="post-outer">
                    <div class="post hentry uncustomized-post-template" itemprop="blogPost" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="http://schema.org/BlogPosting">
                     <meta content="https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-f2my4kyLW2M/WyVCTqJ7ZII/AAAAAAABBdM/hLwF6B87jTEN3eIGmYcnfFKZPp0dVIaKQCLcBGAs/s1600/3%2BPost%2BB%2B1.jpg" itemprop="image_url"/>
                     <meta content="4349727365634393854" itemprop="blogId"/>
                     <meta content="4063557023106628948" itemprop="postId"/>
                     <a name="4063557023106628948">
                     </a>
                     <h3 class="post-title entry-title" itemprop="name">
                      <a href="http://wappellious.blogspot.com/2018/06/the-old-made-new-recycling-old-terrain.html">
                       The Old Made New! Recycling old terrain pieces
                      </a>
                     </h3>
                     <div class="post-header">
                      <div class="post-header-line-1">
                      </div>
                     </div>
                     <div class="post-body entry-content" id="post-body-4063557023106628948" itemprop="description articleBody">
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <a href="https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-f2my4kyLW2M/WyVCTqJ7ZII/AAAAAAABBdM/hLwF6B87jTEN3eIGmYcnfFKZPp0dVIaKQCLcBGAs/s1600/3%2BPost%2BB%2B1.jpg" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;">
                        <img border="0" data-original-height="577" data-original-width="573" src="https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-f2my4kyLW2M/WyVCTqJ7ZII/AAAAAAABBdM/hLwF6B87jTEN3eIGmYcnfFKZPp0dVIaKQCLcBGAs/s1600/3%2BPost%2BB%2B1.jpg"/>
                       </a>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <br/>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       Since I didn't have the time to create an entirely new river terrain piece for the next battle report, I thought it would be a good idea to find a way to "expand" the existing river piece.
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <br/>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       After watching a few documentaries on the Battle or the Boyne, I learned that even small rivers sometimes have very impassable terrain on either bank.  Marshy, boggy and bushy embankments that are almost more hazardous than the river itself!
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <br/>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       So, I hunted around and found some old terrain pieces that I had made for another game system, which looked a lot like large old trees which were decaying in marshy, boggy ground.
                      </div>
                      <br/>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <a href="https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-X8mTsn_a1J4/WyVCUrL7NCI/AAAAAAABBdk/3mP_lkMZ_E8Fc7ahY0TxIMDAHjb3WNFeACLcBGAs/s1600/3%2BPost%2BB%2B2.jpg" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;">
                        <img border="0" data-original-height="909" data-original-width="1440" src="https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-X8mTsn_a1J4/WyVCUrL7NCI/AAAAAAABBdk/3mP_lkMZ_E8Fc7ahY0TxIMDAHjb3WNFeACLcBGAs/s1600/3%2BPost%2BB%2B2.jpg"/>
                       </a>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <br/>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       While I was flocking the main ridgeline/road terrain piece, I thought I could spruce up these old pieces and see if they would work.
                      </div>
                      <br/>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <a href="https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-oB4xbVUH1ns/WyVCUn_IL5I/AAAAAAABBdo/mFPOgnUO-4MdsBIC3dMdRoxdD46z-4_KACLcBGAs/s1600/3%2BPost%2BB%2B3.jpg" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;">
                        <img border="0" data-original-height="1440" data-original-width="1341" src="https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-oB4xbVUH1ns/WyVCUn_IL5I/AAAAAAABBdo/mFPOgnUO-4MdsBIC3dMdRoxdD46z-4_KACLcBGAs/s1600/3%2BPost%2BB%2B3.jpg"/>
                       </a>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <br/>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       Originally, these were designed for a game system where figures could really interact directly with terrain.  That is why the whole piece is relatively flat.  However, that makes it perfect for this task, and by adding some bushes to it, it will break up the round profile and make it better suited for Bolt Action.
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <br/>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       It will reflect the rough terrain that I want, but also offer more cover for entire squads.  The other game system had figures which were much larger, and fewer minis as well.
                      </div>
                      <br/>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <a href="https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-Yg8c0Wcz3S8/WyVCVPzLDII/AAAAAAABBdw/7rGXfaw7qzoXXjMnWJ0CZxR2PhoPtBgtgCLcBGAs/s1600/3%2BPost%2BB%2B4.jpg" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;">
                        <img border="0" data-original-height="820" data-original-width="1200" src="https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-Yg8c0Wcz3S8/WyVCVPzLDII/AAAAAAABBdw/7rGXfaw7qzoXXjMnWJ0CZxR2PhoPtBgtgCLcBGAs/s1600/3%2BPost%2BB%2B4.jpg"/>
                       </a>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <br/>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       It didn't take long to have some nice greenery placed on the bases, which were old DVD plastic protective pieces.  Those date back to the Painting Pyramid video series, where I had to burn and label over 1300 DVD's!
                      </div>
                      <br/>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <a href="https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-ctdzjv1oJNo/WyVCVhUx8bI/AAAAAAABBds/AJJWyrMrv5w6HD748A0fbGi7fvBihy41QCLcBGAs/s1600/3%2BPost%2BB%2B5.jpg" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;">
                        <img border="0" data-original-height="1227" data-original-width="1584" src="https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-ctdzjv1oJNo/WyVCVhUx8bI/AAAAAAABBds/AJJWyrMrv5w6HD748A0fbGi7fvBihy41QCLcBGAs/s1600/3%2BPost%2BB%2B5.jpg"/>
                       </a>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <br/>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       Following the same process you have seen in the other foliage posts, I sprayed the moss with the water and glue mix through the misting spray device and added a few colors and textures.
                      </div>
                      <br/>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <a href="https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-g31cfPjzjws/WyVCV2ibFII/AAAAAAABBd0/iporgYCUdf4xDbnjBB_OU5-5J8JU26j0QCLcBGAs/s1600/3%2BPost%2BB%2B6.jpg" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;">
                        <img border="0" data-original-height="1584" data-original-width="1188" src="https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-g31cfPjzjws/WyVCV2ibFII/AAAAAAABBd0/iporgYCUdf4xDbnjBB_OU5-5J8JU26j0QCLcBGAs/s1600/3%2BPost%2BB%2B6.jpg"/>
                       </a>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <br/>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       The initial layers are done by mixing the fine, dark brown flock with the scraps of greenish flock, followed by lighter layers of fluffier green flock.  This will "shade" the plain bright green moss, almost as if you were painting miniature bushes.
                      </div>
                      <br/>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <a href="https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-V_IqOmBwWAY/WyVCVwuAudI/AAAAAAABBd4/b1bDtaDvP680m-7mqerx-A_6MF1iW5qIgCLcBGAs/s1600/3%2BPost%2BB%2B7.jpg" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;">
                        <img border="0" data-original-height="1121" data-original-width="1584" src="https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-V_IqOmBwWAY/WyVCVwuAudI/AAAAAAABBd4/b1bDtaDvP680m-7mqerx-A_6MF1iW5qIgCLcBGAs/s1600/3%2BPost%2BB%2B7.jpg"/>
                       </a>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <br/>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       You can see the difference this makes, especially when you carry the fine green flock up the sides of the trees like moss... ironic, I know!
                      </div>
                      <br/>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <a href="https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-9r9gdQf0FVc/WyVCWOIlSgI/AAAAAAABBd8/NKW4MUcQOVElJu45pLhmky5GV6mBcwHAwCLcBGAs/s1600/3%2BPost%2BB%2B8.jpg" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;">
                        <img border="0" data-original-height="1126" data-original-width="1584" src="https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-9r9gdQf0FVc/WyVCWOIlSgI/AAAAAAABBd8/NKW4MUcQOVElJu45pLhmky5GV6mBcwHAwCLcBGAs/s1600/3%2BPost%2BB%2B8.jpg"/>
                       </a>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <br/>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       I didn't forget to add my loose leaf tea "deadfall" however!  In the next post, you will see how this brownish color will blend in perfectly with the battle mat!
                      </div>
                      <br/>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <a href="https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-frfePtUwqsU/WyVCWUBBOcI/AAAAAAABBeA/R5AQGMdEzoIpW5kc0ByyJq7cmPNDSTC6QCLcBGAs/s1600/3%2BPost%2BB%2B9.jpg" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;">
                        <img border="0" data-original-height="1196" data-original-width="1600" src="https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-frfePtUwqsU/WyVCWUBBOcI/AAAAAAABBeA/R5AQGMdEzoIpW5kc0ByyJq7cmPNDSTC6QCLcBGAs/s1600/3%2BPost%2BB%2B9.jpg"/>
                       </a>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <br/>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       This piece is my favorite, as it is a tree that I sculpted 17 years ago out of wire and Sculpey!  Originally it was designed as a photo backdrop for our minis, but we learned right away that it was better to have a simple blue/white faded backdrop for that purpose.
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <br/>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       I had ripped it off that 'diorama', but it had been damaged after many years of neglect.  I was almost going to toss it out, but I fixed it up instead and turned it into a terrain piece for another game system.
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <br/>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       Now it has been reborn once again!
                      </div>
                      <br/>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <a href="https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-nESCAdjnhw8/WyVCT5PduDI/AAAAAAABBdU/lin9Uj9H4ZY3W5gCfaxB4mDnmFlVbSbfwCLcBGAs/s1600/3%2BPost%2BB%2B10.jpg" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;">
                        <img border="0" data-original-height="1249" data-original-width="1584" src="https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-nESCAdjnhw8/WyVCT5PduDI/AAAAAAABBdU/lin9Uj9H4ZY3W5gCfaxB4mDnmFlVbSbfwCLcBGAs/s1600/3%2BPost%2BB%2B10.jpg"/>
                       </a>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <br/>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       I really love how it looks now with the added flock and foliage.  In many ways, this is how I originally envisioned it... but didn't have the knowledge and experience that I do now.
                      </div>
                      <br/>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <a href="https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-JfKSgvs_6kk/WyVCT4iQa6I/AAAAAAABBdQ/HUq1dG00LEMF9CJNDb_kF7IjbZgBhKDaACLcBGAs/s1600/3%2BPost%2BB%2B11.jpg" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;">
                        <img border="0" data-original-height="1584" data-original-width="1484" src="https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-JfKSgvs_6kk/WyVCT4iQa6I/AAAAAAABBdQ/HUq1dG00LEMF9CJNDb_kF7IjbZgBhKDaACLcBGAs/s1600/3%2BPost%2BB%2B11.jpg"/>
                       </a>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <br/>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       So, let's have a quick peek at our handiwork...
                      </div>
                      <br/>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <a href="https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-HQbMsHgTtbk/WyVCUP5EvcI/AAAAAAABBdY/M0xswqVZhxMgpzrI26GSVv1M8BAdH2WlgCLcBGAs/s1600/3%2BPost%2BB%2B12.jpg" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;">
                        <img border="0" data-original-height="1147" data-original-width="1584" src="https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-HQbMsHgTtbk/WyVCUP5EvcI/AAAAAAABBdY/M0xswqVZhxMgpzrI26GSVv1M8BAdH2WlgCLcBGAs/s1600/3%2BPost%2BB%2B12.jpg"/>
                       </a>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <br/>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       I was amazed at the transformation of these pieces, which took less than 30 minutes.
                      </div>
                      <br/>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <a href="https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-lzV_wSiOGWU/WyVCUaU7Q-I/AAAAAAABBdc/Z_PLhjeCdpEg89S05080yYdXxv2ZVGSFwCLcBGAs/s1600/3%2BPost%2BB%2B13.jpg" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;">
                        <img border="0" data-original-height="976" data-original-width="1600" src="https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-lzV_wSiOGWU/WyVCUaU7Q-I/AAAAAAABBdc/Z_PLhjeCdpEg89S05080yYdXxv2ZVGSFwCLcBGAs/s1600/3%2BPost%2BB%2B13.jpg"/>
                       </a>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <br/>
                      </div>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       Stay tuned for the next episode, where you will see all the new pieces combined for the brand new Ardennes terrain board.  I am almost set for the next battle in the series, "The Bridge to Nouvion".
                      </div>
                      <br/>
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <a href="https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-mDW8md1CR2I/WyVCUgt7xoI/AAAAAAABBdg/NKppQRlvopoucoq07_1dgPueuSCD5PvBwCLcBGAs/s1600/3%2BPost%2BB%2B14.jpg" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;">
                        <img border="0" data-original-height="1122" data-original-width="1600" src="https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-mDW8md1CR2I/WyVCUgt7xoI/AAAAAAABBdg/NKppQRlvopoucoq07_1dgPueuSCD5PvBwCLcBGAs/s1600/3%2BPost%2BB%2B14.jpg"/>
                       </a>
                      </div>
                      <br/>
                      <div style="clear: both;">
                      </div>
                     </div>
                     <div class="post-footer">
